title: Matrices: Definitions, Examples, and Classification Quiz
description: Test your understanding of matrix terminology, dimensions, and classification.

questions.question: What are the dimensions of a matrix with 3 rows and 4 columns?
questions.explanation: Matrix dimensions are always written as rows × columns.

questions.question: Which of the following is a square matrix?
questions.explanation: A square matrix has equal number of rows and columns. The matrix [1 2; 3 4] is 2×2.

questions.question: What type of matrix is [0 0; 0 0]?
questions.explanation: A zero matrix contains all zero elements.

questions.question: Which matrix represents the identity matrix I₃?
questions.explanation: The identity matrix has 1s on the main diagonal and 0s elsewhere.

questions.question: What is the difference between a row matrix and a column matrix?
options: Row matrix has one row, column matrix has one column
Row matrix is horizontal, column matrix is vertical
Row matrix has more elements than column matrix
questions.explanation: A row matrix has dimensions 1×n, while a column matrix has dimensions n×1.

questions.question: Which of the following matrices is symmetric?
questions.explanation: A symmetric matrix equals its transpose. The matrix [1 2; 2 1] is symmetric.

questions.question: What is the order of a matrix that is both upper triangular and lower triangular?
questions.explanation: A matrix that is both upper and lower triangular must be diagonal, and diagonal matrices can be of any square order.

questions.question: Which matrix represents a skew-symmetric matrix?
questions.explanation: A skew-symmetric matrix A satisfies A^T = -A. The matrix [0 1; -1 0] is skew-symmetric.
